$schema.markdownDescription: JSON schema to use for validation and completions.

schema_version.markdownDescription:
```json
"schema_version": "2.0"
```

Semantic version of the channel's scheme.

repositories.markdownDescription:
```json
"repositories": [
	"./repository/a.json",
	"https://packagecontrol.io/repository/b.json"
]
```

A list of repositories, managed by the channel.

The main purposes of a channel are

- to group various repositories

- provide cached packages/dependencies to reduce a clients network bandwidth.

packages_cache.markdownDescription: A map of repository URLs and lists of packages it provides.

$schema.markdownDescription: JSON schema to use for validation and completions.

schema_version.markdownDescription:
```json
"schema_version": "3.0.0"
```

Semantic version of the channel's scheme.

repositories.markdownDescription:
```json
"repositories": [
	"./repository/a.json",
	"https://packagecontrol.io/repository/b.json"
]
```

A list of repositories, managed by the channel.

The main purposes of a channel are

- to group various repositories

- provide cached packages/dependencies to reduce a clients network bandwidth.

packages_cache.markdownDescription: A map of repository URLs and lists of packages it provides.

dependencies_cache.markdownDescription: A map of repository URLs and lists of dependencies it provides.

$schema.markdownDescription: JSON schema to use for validation and completions.

schema_version.markdownDescription:
```json
"schema_version": "4.0.0"
```

Semantic version of the channel's scheme.

repositories.markdownDescription:
```json
"repositories": [
	"./repository/a.json",
	"https://packagecontrol.io/repository/b.json"
]
```

A list of repositories, managed by the channel.

The main purposes of a channel are

- to group various repositories

- provide cached packages/libraries to reduce a clients network bandwidth.

packages_cache.markdownDescription: A map of repository URLs and lists of packages it provides.

libraries_cache.markdownDescription: A map of repository URLs and lists of libraries it provides.

$schema.markdownDescription: JSON schema to use for validation and completions.

schema_version.markdownDescription:
```json
"schema_version": "2.0"
```

Semantic version of the repository's scheme.

items.markdownDescription:
```json
"https://domain.com/repository.json",
"./subdir/repository.json"
```

URL or URI of a repository.

Relative paths are resolved using the owning directory of this repository.

ResolvedPackagesList.markdownDescription:
```json
"https://packagecontrol.io/package.json": [
	{
		"name": "My Package",
		"description": "A Sublime Text plugin to ...",
		"author": "John Doe",
		"homepage": "www.my-package-homepage.com",
		"releases": []
	}
]
```

A mapping of repository URLs and lists of resolved package information, provided.

This means that the `"details"` key must be expanded into the various keys it provides.

ResolvedPackage.markdownDescription:
```json
{
	"name": "My Package",
	"description": "A Sublime Text plugin to ...",
	"author": "John Doe",
	"homepage": "www.my-package-homepage.com",
	"releases": []
}
```

Resolved information about a package.

This means that the `"details"` key must be expanded into the various keys it provides.

ResolvedPackageReleasesList.markdownDescription: A list of package release artefacts.

oneOf.markdownDescription:
```json
{
	"name": "May Package",
	"details": "https://github.com/user/repo",
	"releases": []
}
```

Information about a package.

```json
{
	"name": "My Package",
	"description": "A Sublime Text plugin to ...",
	"author": "John Doe",
	"issues": "https://github.com/user/repo/issues",
	"releases": []
}
```

Information about a package.

PackageTemplateReleasesList.markdownDescription: A list of package release templates or artefacts.

PackageReleaseArtefact.markdownDescription: A release with an explicit `version` and `url` to download the binary from.

PackageReleaseTemplate.markdownDescription: A release template, which uses given `tags` specification to collect available releases from `base` or package's `details` url.

DetailsValue.markdownDescription:
URL of a BitBucket/Github/Gitlab repository to fetch information about the package or dependency from.

Can be a relative path to the location of this repository.json (e.g.: `../mypackage`).

NameValue.markdownDescription: The name a package or dependency is installed as.

DescriptionValue.markdownDescription: A brief description of what the package/dependency is used for.

LoadOrderValue.markdownDescription: A string of two digits defining load order of the depencency.

AuthorValue.markdownDescription: A string or list of author names.

IssuesValue.markdownDescription: URL of a website bugs/issues can be reported at.

HomepageValue.markdownDescription: URL of a homepage used to represent the package online.

ReadmeValue.markdownDescription: URL of a readme file in Markdown, Creole or reStructuredText, with a detailed description of the package, how it is installed and used.

BuyValue.markdownDescription: URL of a website used to buy a licence for the package.

DonateValue.markdownDescription: URL of a website for donations.

LabelsValue.markdownDescription: A list of keywords which can be used for filtering.

LastModifiedValue.markdownDescription:
```json
"last_modified": "2021-03-06 19:43:21"
```

Timestamp the package/library has been modified in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.

PreviousNamesValue.markdownDescription: A list of names previously used by the package/dependency. It is required to automatically rename old packages on clients when upgrading packages.

date.markdownDescription:
```json
"date": "2021-03-06 19:43:21"
```

Timestamp of the package/dependency release in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.

details.markdownDescription:
```json
"base": "https://github.com/user/repository"
```

URL of a BitBucket/Github/Gitlab repository to fetch information about available releases from.

The key is required only, if no or a differend `details` URL is specified by the owning package.

platforms.markdownDescription:
A list of platforms, supported by the package/dependency release.

Can contain a wildcard

```json
"platforms": ["*"]
```

or a supported plattform names

```json
"platforms": ["linux", "osx-arm64", "windows-x64"]
```

sublime_text.markdownDescription:
```json
"sublime_text": "*"
```

Sublime Text build selector

Valid selectors are of the form:

- `*`
- `<4107`
- `<=4107`
- `>4107`
- `>=4107`
- `4107 - 4143`

url.markdownDescription:
```json
"url": "https://any-domain.com/downloads/mypackage-2.0.0.zip"
```

URL of the download artefact.

The URL needs to be a zip file containing the package.

It is permissible for the zip file to contain a single root folder with any name. All file will be extracted out of this single root folder. This allows zip files from GitHub and BitBucket to be used a sources.

The URL can be relative to the location of this repository.json (e.g.: `./downloads/mypackage-2.0.0.zip`).

_Used in conjunction with `version`._

version.markdownDescription:
```json
"version": "1.0.0"
```

A semantic version string.

_Used in conjunction with `url`._

branch.markdownDescription:
Create branch based releases.

---
```json
"branch": true
```

If `true`, a release is created for the repositorie's default branch.

---

```json
"branch": "any-branch"
```

A `string` value specifies a branch name to create releases from.

date.markdownDescription:
```json
"date": "2021-03-06 19:43:21"
```

Timestamp of the package/dependency release in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.

```json

```

A list of dependency names required by the package/dependency release.

platforms.markdownDescription:

```json
"platforms": ["*"]
```

or a supported plattform names

```json
"platforms": ["linux", "osx-arm64", "windows-x64"]
```

sublime_text.markdownDescription:
```json
"sublime_text": "*"
```

Sublime Text build selector

- `4107 - 4143`

sha256.markdownDescription:
```json
"sha256": "efe25e3bdf2e8f791d86327978aabe093c9597a6ceb8c2fb5438c1d810e02bea"
```

Download artefact checksum.

_Used in conjunction with `url`._

tags.markdownDescription:
Create tag based releases.

---
```json
"tag": true
```

If `true`, a release is created for each tag named like a semantic version (e.g.: `1.0.0`).

---

```json
"tag": "st3-"
```

A `string` value specifies a prefix a tag must start with followed by a semantic version to be picked up as release (e.g.: `st3-1.0.0`).

url.markdownDescription:
```json
"url": "https://any-domain.com/downloads/mypackage-2.0.0.zip"
```

URL of the download artefact.

The URL needs to be a zip file containing the package.

It is permissible for the zip file to contain a single root folder with any name. All file will be extracted out of this single root folder. This allows zip files from GitHub and BitBucket to be used a sources.

The URL can be relative to the location of this repository.json (e.g.: `./downloads/mypackage-2.0.0.zip`).

_Used in conjunction with `version`._

version.markdownDescription:
```json
"version": "1.0.0"
```

A semantic version string.

_Used in conjunction with `url`._

DetailsValue.markdownDescription:
URL of a BitBucket/Github/Gitlab repository to fetch information about the package or library from.

Can be a relative path to the location of this repository.json (e.g.: `../mypackage`).

NameValue.markdownDescription: The name a package or library is installed as.

DescriptionValue.markdownDescription: A brief description of what the package/library is used for.

AuthorValue.markdownDescription: A string or list of author names.

IssuesValue.markdownDescription: URL of a website bugs/issues can be reported at.

HomepageValue.markdownDescription: URL of a homepage used to represent the package online.

ReadmeValue.markdownDescription: URL of a readme file in Markdown, Creole or reStructuredText, with a detailed description of the package, how it is installed and used.

BuyValue.markdownDescription: URL of a website used to buy a licence for the package.

DonateValue.markdownDescription: URL of a website for donations.

LabelsValue.markdownDescription: A list of keywords which can be used for filtering.

LastModifiedValue.markdownDescription:
```json
"last_modified": "2021-03-06 19:43:21"
```

Timestamp the package/library has been modified in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.

PreviousNamesValue.markdownDescription: A list of names previously used by the package/library. It is required to automatically rename old packages on clients when upgrading packages.

asset.markdownDescription:
```jsonc
"asset": "FileName-*.*.*-${platform}.sublime-package"
```

A pattern to describe the display name of a download asset associated with a Bitbucket/GitHub/GitLab release.

The pattern supports fnmatch like placeholders as well as variable expansion.

> If `"asset"` is present `"tags"` key is required only to specify a tag prefix.

---

### Globs

- `*` : any number of characters
- `?` : single character placeholder

---

### Variables

Variable are expanded with information from owning release specification.

New release specifications are created for each combination of expanded variables.

---

### `${platform}`



A platform-arch string as given in `"platforms"` list of owning release specification.

A separate explicit release is evaluated for each platform.

If `"platforms": ['*']` is specified, variable is set to `"any"`.

---

### `${py_version}`



Major and minor part of required python version without period.

One of `"33"`, `"38"` or any other valid python version supported by ST.

> Note: This variable is only useful for libraries.

---

### `${st_build}`



Value of `"sublime_text"` key of owning release specification stripped by operators.

```
"*"            => "any"
">=4107"       => "4107"
"<4107"        => "4107"
"4107 - 4126"  => "4107"
```

---

### `${version}`



Resolved SemVer / PEP440 without tag prefix  
(e.g.: tag = st4107-1.0.5 => version 1.0.5)

$schema.markdownDescription: JSON schema to use for validation and completions.

SublimeTextSelectors.markdownDescription: Dictionary of Sublime Text selectors and lists of libraries to install for the given platform.

^(?:\\*|(?:>=?|<=?)\\d{4}|\\d{4} - \\d{4.markdownDescription:
List of libraries to install for given platform and Sublime Text build.

Valid selectors are of the form:

- `*`
- `<4107`
- `<=4107`
- `>4107`
- `>=4107`
- `4107 - 4143`
